item.title: Microsoft Announces Xbox Partner Preview For This Thursday, Will Feature 007 First Light, Reanimal, and More
item.content:encoded:
Amidst the craze of The Game Awards 2025 nominees being announced, Microsoft and Xbox revealed that it is hosting an Xbox Partner Preview later this week on November 20, 2025. The show will feature games from Xbox's third-party partners, including IO Interactive showing off more of 007 First Light and Tarsier Studios showing off more of Reanimal.

The preview event will take place at 10am PT / 1pm ET / 6pm BT on Thursday, November 20, and you'll be able to watch it live on YouTube, Twitch, and TikTok, though Xbox doesn't say how long it will be.

"We’re excited to reveal that the next Xbox Partner Preview – our broadcast that shines a light on upcoming games from our talented third-party partners – is coming this Thursday, November 20," a post on Xbox Wire reads. "This show will include news on upcoming games from partners including IO Interactive, Tencent and THQ Nordic, plus some brand-new reveals and Game Pass announcements."

We know that both 007 First Light and Reanimal are aiming to release sometime in 2026, the latter of which is still missing a specific release date. So it's probably safe to say we won't be hearing about games that are going to hit shelves before the end of this year, with this preview event focused more on games arriving in 2026, more specifically, the first half of 2026.

Tides of Annihilation getting a mention in the Xbox Wire post is interesting, since we've not seen much of that game since earlier this year when Wccftech spoke to the development team. Perhaps we'll finally learn of the game's release date in this showcase. Overall, hopefully the show has one or two interesting announcements for those tuning in.

Follow Wccftech on Google to get more of our news coverage in your feeds.



https://wccftech.com/microsoft-announces-xbox-partner-preview-thursday/

item.title: The Game Awards 2025 Nominees Have Been Revealed, Clair Obscur Stuns With 12 Nominations
item.content:encoded:
Ahead of the show on December 11, 2025, Geoff Keighley and The Game Awards team revealed the full list of nominees for the 2025 Game Awards, including the games up for the show's most significant award, Game of the Year (though the nominees for Game of the Year did unfortunately leak ahead of the reveal).

Some years, the nomination count is tight between the few games favourited to win the big Game of the Year prize, with only one or two nominations differentiating them from their closest competition. This is not one of those years, as Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is the runaway leader with 12 nominations total across each of the categories.

It's worth noting that three of those nominations are all for performances by actors in the game, though even removing those three, they're still above the next closest titles, Death Stranding 2: On the Beach and Ghost of Yotei, which are both tied with seven nominations each.

The next closest game is Hades 2, which earned six nominations, followed by Hollow Knight Silksong with five, Split Fiction with four, and despite making it into the Game of the Year nominees, Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 only walked away with three nominations (including GOTY).

It's not the only GOTY nominee with a low nomination count, though, as Donkey Kong Bananza eeked its way into the nominees for GOTY, but only received one other nomination for Best Family Game.

As far as recent releases making the list, two interesting points stand out. One is that Marvel's Deadpool VR was nominated for Best VR/AR Game, though it's not officially out until tomorrow, November 18, 2025. The other is Dispatch, which made its way into the Best Debut Indie list after having just released the final episode of its eight-episode arc on November 12.

Voting is now officially open for The Game Awards 2025, and you can go to the official website to cast your vote. Here's the full list of nominees for the 2025 Game Awards:

The Game Awards 2025 Nominees Full List

Best Performance

  • Ben Starr - Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Charlie Cox - Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Erika Ishii - Ghost of Yotei
  • Jennifer English - Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Konatsu Kato - Silent Hill f
  • Troy Baker - Indiana Jones and the Great Circle

Best Ongoing Game

  • Final Fantasy XIV: Dawntrail
  • Fortnite
  • Helldivers 2
  • Marvel Rivals
  • No Man's Sky

Best Mobile Game

  • Destiny Rising
  • Persona 5: The Phantom X
  • Sonic Rumble
  • Umamasume: Pretty Derby
  • Wuthering Waves

Best Art Direction

  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Death Stranding 2: On the Beach
  • Ghost of Yotei
  • Hades 2
  • Hollow Knight Silksong

Best Score and Music

  • Christopher Larkin - Hollow Knight Silksong
  • Darren Korb - Hades 2
  • Lorien Testard - Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Toma Otowa - Ghost of Yotei
  • Woodkid and Ludvig Forssell - Death Stranding 2: On the Beach

Best Audio Design

  • Battlefield 6
  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Death Stranding 2: On the Beach
  • Ghost of Yotei
  • Silent Hill f

Best Adaptation

  • A Minecraft Movie
  • Devil May Cry
  • Splinter Cell Deathwatch
  • HBO's The Last of Us Season 2
  • Until Dawn

Best Narrative

  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Death Stranding 2: On the Beach
  • Ghost of Yotei
  • Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2
  • Silent Hil f

Best Community Support

  • Baldur's Gate 3
  • Final Fantasy XIV: Dawntrail
  • Fortnite
  • Helldivers 2
  • No Man's Sky

Games for Impact

  • Consume Me
  • Despelote
  • Lost Records: Bloom and Rage
  • South of Midnight
  • Wanderstop

Best Multiplayer

  • ARC Raiders
  • Battlefield 6
  • Elden Ring Nightreign
  • Peak
  • Split Fiction

Best Independent Game

  • Absolum
  • Ball X Pit
  • Blue Prince
  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Hades 2
  • Hollow Knight Silksong

Best Debut Indie Game

  • Blue Prince
  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Despelote
  • Dispatch
  • Megabonk

Best VR/AR Game

  • Marvel's Deadpool VR
  • The Midnight Walk

Content Creator of the Year

  • Kai Cenat
  • MoistCr1tikal
  • Sakura Miko
  • The Burnt Peanut

Most Anticipated Game

  • 007: First Light
  • Grand Theft Auto VI
  • Marvel's Wolverine
  • Resident Evil Requiem
  • The Witcher IV

Best Action Adventure Game

  • Death Stranding 2: On the Beach
  • Ghost of Yotei
  • Hollow Knight Silksong
  • Indiana Jones and the Great Circle
  • Split Fiction

Best Role-Playing Game

  • Avowed
  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2
  • Monster Hunter Wilds
  • The Outer Worlds 2

Best Fighting Game

  • Capcom Fighting Collection 2

Best Action Game

  • Battlefield 6

  • Hades 2

Innovation in Accessibility

  • EA Sports FC 26
  • South of Midnight

Best Family Game

  • Donkey Kong Bananza

  • Mario Kart World
  • Sonic Racing: Crossworlds
  • Split Fiction

Best Sim/Strategy Game

  • The Alters
  • Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles
  • Jurassic World Evolution 3

  • Tempest Rising
  • Two Point Museum

Best Sports/Racing Game

  • Mario Kart World
  • Rematch
  • Sonic Racing: Crossworlds

Best Esports Game

  • Valorant

  • Chovy
  • Forsaken
  • Kakeru
  • Menard

Best Esports Team

  • Gen.G - League of Legends
  • NRG - Valorant
  • Team Falcons - DOTA 2
  • Team Liquid PH - Mobile Legends Bang Bang
  • Team Vitality - Counter-Strike 2

Best Game Direction

  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Death Stranding 2: On the Beach
  • Ghost of Yotei
  • Hades 2
  • Split Fiction

Game of the Year

  • Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
  • Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2
  • Death Stranding 2: On the Beach
  • Donkey Kong Bananza
